rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/situatingarchitecture-peterbishop"> <title>Peter Bishop - Situating Architecture Lecture Series</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/situatingarchitecture-peterbishop</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/kings-cross-allies-and-morrisson" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>Kings Cross is politically in Camden but geographically in Islington. It is beyond the city limits, a between place, a void. In this lecture, Peter Bishop will explore the influence of history, place and politics on the evolution of the master plan that is driving the regeneration of the area. He will follow the evolution of the plan from first propositions and initial sketches to the design of a single building, and reflect on the political undercurrents that have shaped an emerging piece of city.</description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Mark Burgess</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-01-23T14:10:29Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Rm G02, 140 Hampstead Road, London NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-16T13:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-16T14:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/phd-student-talk-from-the-school-of-planning"> <title>PhD Research Student Talk from the School of Planning - Richard Timmerman</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/phd-student-talk-from-the-school-of-planning</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/Richard-Timmerman.jpg" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description><strong>Richard Timmerman</strong><br />School of Planning<br /><strong>The Community Customisation of Planned Urban Spaces:\ufffd\ufffd Exploring customisation as an alternative interpretation of Christopher Alexander's semi-lattice concept in the development of urban spaces<br /></strong><br />With the criticisms of 1960s urban planning and design system still valid to today\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds practices, where planned environments are often described as lifeless, recent criticisms have suggested that the problem lies in the system\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds inability to accommodate the holistic needs of the end-user communities affected.\ufffd\ufffd Considering Alexander\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds semi-lattice theory as a viable implementation of lateral thinking into the urban design process, this thesis examines the effectiveness of adaptive community customisation practices in the development of successful urban spaces. <br /> <br />First, using observation analysis, this research examines the use of urban spaces in relation to their customised and unaltered features.\ufffd\ufffd Second, employing quantitative analysis, correlations between customised urban spaces and user satisfaction will be studied thus testing the effectiveness of community customisation in the development of successful urban spaces.<br /><br /></description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Jean Garrett</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-01-07T17:07:42Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Rm 206, 140 Hampstead Road, NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-17T14:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-17T15:30:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/phd-conversations-marcela-araguez-and-nerea-amoros-elorduy"> <title>PhD Research Conversations \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Marcela Arag\ufffd\ufffdez & Nerea Amoros Elorduy</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/phd-conversations-marcela-araguez-and-nerea-amoros-elorduy</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/Marcela-Araguez-Nerea-Amoros-Elorduy.jpg" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>Join current Bartlett School of Architecture PhD candidates as they present their work in progress.</description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Jean Garrett</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-01-07T17:07:42Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Rm 206, 140 Hampstead Road, NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-17T16:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-17T19:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/contested-urbanism-london-stockholm-jerusalem"> <title>Contested Urbanism - Learning from London, Stockholm and Jerusalem</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/contested-urbanism-london-stockholm-jerusalem</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/images/2014-15/Al-Isawiyyah__a_Palestinian_Neighbourhood_in_East_Jerusalem.png" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>This presentation will address some recent thoughts around present and future research projects; starting with current UCL Bartlett Grand Challenges research into immigrants and minorities well-being in Barking, East London. The intention of the lecture is to place the London case within a general theoretical interest considering the comparative value of<em> </em>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdurban difference\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Associating this with a future research project; &quot;Contested Cities Revisited: a Multidisciplinary, Multi-Scale Analysis of Urban Space&quot; - a two year Marie Curie fellowship investigating the role of political, spatial and social factors in shaping urban segregation in Swedish and Israeli cities.\ufffd\ufffd</description> <dc:subject>The DPU at The Bartlett: planning for a socially just and sustainable development in the Global South.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Matthew A Wood-Hill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:33:05Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Room 101, DPU, 34 Tavistock Square, London, WC1H 9EZ</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-17T17:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-17T19:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/sophie-de-oliveira-barata-material-matters"> <title>Sophie de Oliveira Barata \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Material Matters Lecture Series</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/sophie-de-oliveira-barata-material-matters</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/sophieoliveirbarara-web" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description><strong>Sophie de Oliveira Barata</strong> is an artist trained in special effects prosthetics who recognises the creative, self-expressive possibilities that artificial limbs hold. After nearly a decade of working for medical prosthetic providers, Sophie founded the <a href="http://www.thealternativelimbproject.com/" target="_blank">Alternative Limb Project</a> in 2011. Her studio offers a bespoke service to amputees that either allows their prostheses to blend in with their bodies or stand out as unique pieces of art that reflects the wearers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd imagination, personality, and interests. Some of Sophie\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds out-of-the-box creations include a leg with an embedded stereo, another with removable muscles, and a third that houses mini drawers.<br /></description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Michelle Lukins</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-06T11:13:17Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>The Bartlett School of Architecture, Rm. G02, 140 Hamsptead Road, London, NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-17T18:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-17T20:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/glasshouse-london-debate"> <title>Do we accept the status quo in place?</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/glasshouse-london-debate</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/images/glasshouse-london-debate" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>How has our culture determined how we make places? Have we demanded enough of ourselves? If we were more proactive, would our ambitions become a reality?</description> <dc:subject>The Bartlett, UCL's global faculty of the built environment.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Anthony P Grout</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:21:04Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>B304-LT1, UCL Cruciform Building, Gower Street, London WC1E 6BT</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-18T18:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-18T20:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/situatingarchitecture-ninavollenbroker"> <title>Nina Vollenbroker - Situating Architecture Lecture Series</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/situatingarchitecture-ninavollenbroker</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/situatingarchitecture-ninavollenbroker" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>This talk considers what kind of spatial knowledge might be produced through a scholarly lens focused not on stasis and permanence but on movement and contestation.</description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Mark Burgess</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-01-23T14:33:07Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Rm G02, 140 Hampstead Road, London NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-23T13:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-23T14:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/open-crits-architecture"> <title>Open Crits</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/open-crits-architecture</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/opencrits-bartlett" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description><strong>Architecture Year 3 and Year 5<br />24 &amp; 26 March 2015</strong><br /></description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Michelle Lukins</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-25T15:41:31Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>The Bartlett School of Architecture UCL, Rm. G02, 140 Hampstead Road, London, NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-24T09:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-26T18:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/frederic-migayrou-situating-architecture-lecture-series"> <title>Fr\ufffd\ufffdd\ufffd\ufffdric Migayrou \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Situating Architecture Lecture Series</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/frederic-migayrou-situating-architecture-lecture-series</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/nerioxman" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description><strong>Fr\ufffd\ufffdd\ufffd\ufffdric Migayrou </strong>is Chair, Bartlett Professor of Architecture at The Bartlett School of Architecture and Deputy Director of the National Museum of Art, Centre Pompidou in Paris. He was the founder of the Frac Center Collection and of ArchiLab, the international festival of Prospective Architecture in Orl\ufffd\ufffdans. Apart from recent publications and exhibitions (<em>De Stijl</em>, Centre Pompidou, 2011; <em>La Tendenza,</em> Centre Pompidou, 2012; <em>Bernard Tschumi</em>, Centre Pompidou, 2013; <em>Frank Gehry</em>, Centre Pompidou 2014), he was the curator of <em>Non Standard Architectures</em> at the Centre Pompidou in 2003, the first exposition devoted to architecture, computation and fabrication. More recently he has curated <em>Japan Architects 1945-2010</em> (21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art, 2014), <em>Frank Gehry </em>(Foundation Louis Vuitton, Paris 2014) and <em>Naturalising Architecture</em> (ArchiLab, Orl\ufffd\ufffdans 2013). In 2012 he founded B-Pro, The Bartlett\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds umbrella structure for post-professional architecture programmes.<br /><br /><strong>Situating Architecture</strong> is a new architectural history lecture series on Monday lunchtimes at The Bartlett School of Architecture. Lectures are free and open to members of the public on a first come, first seated basis. Places are limited so early arrival is recommended.</description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Michelle Lukins</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-13T16:02:09Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>The Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL, Rm. G02, 140 Hampstead Road, London NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-24T13:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-24T14:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/energy/events/seminar-green-deal-home-energy"> <title>UCL Energy Seminar: 'Financing Home Energy Efficiency: Lessons from the Green Deal and Needs for the Future' with Mark Bayley CEO of The Green Deal Finance Company and Petter Allison, commercial director</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/energy/events/seminar-green-deal-home-energy</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/energy/events/Images_Events/thermal_house.jpg" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>The Green Deal is a world first \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd linking in customers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd minds and in IT systems, the concept that home energy efficiency can be financed from future energy bill savings. Enabled by statute and regulated by algorithms and codes of practice, a householder can obtain tailored energy efficiency recommendations and an estimate of energy bill savings, and repay costs proportionate to savings via the electricity bill. The Green Deal Finance Company is a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdstart-up\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd funded by Government, Obligated Energy Suppliers, and others interested in energy efficiency, to facilitate and administer the bold move away from 100% subsidy finance for household energy efficiency, to a mixed economy of subsidy and householder contributions via Pay-As-You-Save. Today it has on-going finance plans and applications for over 10,000 homes with a value of about \ufffd\ufffd40m, half of which was delivered in the last 6 months. Over 500 households a week apply for Green Deal finance via a network of more than 60 SME Providers.\ufffd\ufffd GDFC finance can also be obtained by 80% of the UK adult population. Has the Green Deal Finance Company \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdturned the corner\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, and if so, how was that achieved? And what lessons have been learned to inform possible future policies?</description> <dc:subject>The UCL Energy Institute, part of The Bartlett: UCL's global faculty of the built environment.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Anna Martinez</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:06:53Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>G01 Central House, 14 Upper Woburn Place London WC1H 0NN</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-24T17:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-24T20:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/street-trading-global-south-practical-theoretical-challenges"> <title>Street trading in the Global South: Practical and theoretical challenges</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/street-trading-global-south-practical-theoretical-challenges</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/dpu/events/images/2014-15/Web_image.jpg" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>Street trading, a widespread practice in Global South cities, is a growing phenomenon. City authorities are confronted with practical difficulties due to the contradictions that street trading generates in the context of 'modernising' cities. Theoretical constructs are important to build a deeper and more integrated understanding so as to design suitable and adapted responses to the problem in the context of the Global South. <br /></description> <dc:subject>The DPU at The Bartlett: planning for a socially just and sustainable development in the Global South.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Matthew A Wood-Hill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-12T17:40:31Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>DPU Room 101, 34 Tavistock Square, London WC1H 9EZ</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-25T08:45:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-25T18:30:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/omega-knee-mar-2015"> <title>Hinkley Point C: The first UK nuclear power mega-project for a generation</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/omega-knee-mar-2015</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/planning/events/images/omega-seminar-series" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>Dr. Nigel Knee<br />Head of External Affairs, Nuclear New Build UK<br />EDF Energy</description> <dc:subject>The Bartlett, UCL's global faculty of the built environment.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Anthony P Grout</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-01-08T15:44:32Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Room G01, Central House, 14 Upper Woburn Place, London WC1H 0NN</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-25T17:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-25T19:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/ethics-in-built-environment-phd-research"> <title>Ethics in Built Environment PhD Research</title> <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/ethics-in-built-environment-phd-research</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/ethicsbuiltenvirophdresearch" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description> As part of the project, 'Ethics in Built Environment Research', this event will be a day of presentations  and discussions of ethical issues - practical and conceptual \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd  encountered by PhD students from across The Bartlett.\ufffd\ufffd</description> <dc:subject>Welcome to the Bartlett School of Architecture, UCL's world-leading centre for education and research in architecture.</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Michelle Lukins</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-20T12:35:02Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Rm 206, 140 Hampstead Road, The Bartlett School of Architecture, London NW1 2BX</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2015-03-27T10:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2015-03-27T17:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item <link>https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/lobby-issue-2-launch</link> <enclosure url="https://www.bartlett.ucl.ac.uk/architecture/events/images/lobby-launch-2" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>The LOBBY team at The Bartlett School of Architecture invites you to their launch party, in celebration of LOBBY magazine's brand-new website and of their second print issue 'Clairvoyance'.<br /><br />*LOBBY will be sold at \ufffd\ufffd10, with a 50% discount to BSA students who bring their i.d.<br />*Beer, Wine and Vodka Cocktails<br />*DJ Julien K-Boogie of
